categories.nervous_system: Techniques and practices for calming and regulating the nervous system
categories.sleep: Sleep hygiene, routines, and quality improvement strategies
categories.pacing: Energy management and sustainable activity planning
categories.movement: Gentle exercise, stretching, and physical activity ideas
categories.body_care: Self-care rituals, skincare, and body maintenance
categories.accessibility: Adaptive tools and accommodations for daily living
categories.hydration: Water intake, electrolytes, and fluid management
categories.medical_admin: Healthcare appointments, records, and medication management

items.title: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding Exercise
items.description: Name 5 things you see, 4 you hear, 3 you can touch, 2 you smell, and 1 you taste. This sensory awareness technique helps anchor you to the present moment during anxiety.

items.title: Bilateral Stimulation Walk
items.description: Walking while alternately tapping your thighs or crossing your arms activates both brain hemispheres, helping process emotions and calm the nervous system.
instructions: Add alternate leg tapping or arm crosses
Allow thoughts to flow without judgment

items.title: Physiological Sigh
items.description: Two quick inhales through the nose followed by a long exhale through the mouth. This is the fastest known way to calm the nervous system in real-time.
instructions: Inhale through nose until lungs are half full
Exhale slowly through mouth for full duration

items.title: Vagal Toning Gargle
items.description: Gargling water vigorously stimulates the vagus nerve, activating the parasympathetic 'rest and digest' system and building vagal tone over time.
instructions: Gargle vigorously until eyes water slightly

items.title: Temperature Regulation Reset
items.description: Applying cold to the face or wrists triggers the mammalian dive reflex, immediately slowing heart rate and calming the nervous system.
instructions: Fill bowl with cold water and ice
Submerge face for 30 seconds (or apply ice pack to face/wrists)

items.title: Sleep Window Identification
items.description: Track your natural sleep-wake patterns for two weeks to identify your ideal 'sleep window' - the time your body naturally wants to sleep.
instructions: Log sleep and wake times daily

items.title: Non-Sleep Deep Rest Protocol
items.description: A guided relaxation technique that provides restorative benefits similar to sleep without actually sleeping. Perfect for energy restoration and stress relief.

items.title: Bedroom Environment Audit
items.description: Systematically evaluate and optimize your sleep environment for temperature, darkness, sound, air quality, and comfort.

items.title: Cognitive Shuffle Sleep Technique
items.description: Visualize random, unconnected images to prevent the logical thinking that keeps you awake. The randomness mimics pre-sleep brain activity.
instructions: Visualize objects starting with that letter
Each image should be unrelated to the last
Switch letters if you run out

items.title: Wind-Down Ritual Design
items.description: Create a consistent 30-60 minute pre-sleep routine that signals to your brain it's time to sleep, making sleep onset easier and more reliable.
instructions: End in bedroom doing restful activity

items.title: Energy Envelope Tracking
items.description: Monitor your energy expenditure vs. available energy throughout the day to stay within your 'energy envelope' and prevent boom-bust cycles.
instructions: Track all activities and their energy cost

items.title: Activity-Rest Cycling
items.description: Alternate focused activity periods with intentional rest breaks using specific time ratios to maintain sustainable energy throughout the day.

items.title: Priority Energy Allocation
items.description: Identify your highest-priority activities and schedule them during your peak energy times, reserving low-energy tasks for energy slumps.
instructions: Fill low-energy times with easier tasks

items.title: Pre-emptive Rest Strategy
items.description: Schedule rest BEFORE you feel tired, not after. Strategic pre-emptive rest prevents energy crashes and maintains more consistent function.
instructions: Schedule rest 30-60 minutes before those times
Take rest even if feeling okay

items.title: Baseline Activity Assessment
items.description: Determine your sustainable baseline of daily activities by tracking and adjusting over several weeks until you find a level that doesn't cause crashes.
instructions: Log all activities for one week
Maintain new level for one week

items.title: Gentle Morning Stretching
items.description: A 10-minute sequence of gentle stretches designed to wake up the body, improve circulation, and prepare joints for the day ahead.

items.title: Micro-Movement Breaks
items.description: Set reminders to move for 30-60 seconds every 30 minutes. Small frequent movements prevent the damage of prolonged sitting.

items.title: Lymphatic Bounce
items.description: Gentle bouncing on a mini trampoline or in place stimulates the lymphatic system, supporting immune function and reducing swelling.
instructions: Begin gentle bouncing (feet can stay on surface)

items.title: Restorative Yoga Sequence
items.description: A sequence of supported yoga poses held for 5-10 minutes each, designed to deeply relax the body and calm the nervous system.

items.title: Walking Meditation
items.description: Combine gentle walking with mindfulness, focusing on the sensations of each step to create a moving meditation practice.
best_for: Those who struggle sitting to meditate
instructions: Focus on each foot lifting, moving, placing
Notice sensations in feet and legs
When mind wanders, return to feet

items.title: Facial Massage Routine
items.description: A 5-minute daily facial massage routine that promotes lymphatic drainage, reduces tension, and supports skin health.
instructions: Apply oil or serum to face
Use gentle upward and outward strokes

items.title: Dry Brushing Protocol
items.description: Use a natural bristle brush on dry skin before showering to stimulate circulation, support lymphatic function, and exfoliate dead skin.
instructions: Start at feet with firm strokes toward heart
Shower after to wash away dead skin

items.title: Evening Foot Care Ritual
items.description: A relaxing evening routine focusing on foot care including soaking, exfoliation, moisturizing, and massage.
instructions: Soak feet in warm water with Epsom salt 10 min
Put on cotton socks if desired

items.title: Scalp Massage for Tension Relief
items.description: A targeted massage technique for the scalp that relieves headache tension, promotes relaxation, and may support hair health.
instructions: Finish with gentle pulls at roots

items.title: Hand Care for Desk Workers
items.description: A comprehensive hand and wrist care routine including stretches, massage, and moisturizing specifically designed for those who type frequently.

items.title: Vision-Friendly Workspace Setup
items.description: Optimize your workspace for eye health and visual comfort with proper monitor positioning, lighting, and contrast settings.
instructions: Top of screen at eye level
Follow 20-20-20 rule (every 20 min, look 20 feet away for 20 sec)

items.title: Audio Accessibility Setup
items.description: Configure devices and environment to support hearing needs including volume optimization, captions, and notification systems.
instructions: Enable captions on all video platforms
Set up visual alerts for notifications

items.title: Energy-Conserving Kitchen Setup
items.description: Reorganize your kitchen to minimize energy expenditure during meal preparation, including tool selection and workflow optimization.
instructions: Move frequently used items to waist height

items.title: Sensory-Friendly Environment Design
items.description: Modify living spaces to reduce sensory overwhelm including lighting, sound management, and texture considerations.
instructions: Audit each room for sensory input
Add soft furnishings to reduce echoes

items.title: Adaptive Clothing Solutions
items.description: Modify your wardrobe for easier dressing with sensory-friendly fabrics, adaptive closures, and thoughtful organization.
instructions: Organize by outfit, not item type
Add visual or tactile labels if helpful

items.title: Hydration Tracking System
items.description: Set up a simple system to track and maintain optimal hydration throughout the day using visual cues and reminders.

items.title: Electrolyte Balance Protocol
items.description: Learn to recognize electrolyte imbalance signs and create a protocol for maintaining proper mineral balance alongside water intake.

items.title: Morning Hydration Ritual
items.description: A simple morning routine to rehydrate after sleep, kickstart metabolism, and set up good hydration habits for the day.
instructions: Add lemon or electrolytes if desired

items.title: Hydrating Food Integration
items.description: Strategically add high-water-content foods to your diet to supplement liquid intake and improve overall hydration.
instructions: Add one hydrating food per meal

items.title: Herbal Hydration Variety
items.description: Create a rotation of caffeine-free herbal teas and infusions to make hydration more appealing and add functional benefits.
instructions: Rotate based on needs and mood

items.title: Medical Appointment Preparation System
items.description: A structured approach to preparing for medical appointments including symptom tracking, question lists, and documentation organization.
instructions: Have someone take notes if possible

items.title: Medication Management System
items.description: Set up a comprehensive system for tracking medications including timing, refills, interactions, and side effect monitoring.

items.title: Health Records Organization
items.description: Create a comprehensive personal health record system that's accessible, secure, and useful for coordinating care across providers.

items.title: Healthcare Team Coordination
items.description: Develop a system for keeping all healthcare providers informed and coordinating care across specialties.

items.title: Insurance Navigation Guide
items.description: Create a personal reference for navigating your specific insurance including coverage, appeals processes, and cost management.

items.title: Co-Regulation Partner Practice
items.description: Learn to use the calm nervous system of a trusted person to help regulate your own through presence, breathing together, and safe connection.
instructions: Make gentle eye contact if comfortable
Allow their calm to influence yours

items.title: Somatic Stress Release
items.description: Use gentle shaking and tremoring to release stored stress from the body, a natural mechanism seen in animals after threat.

items.title: Sleep Restriction Therapy
items.description: A counterintuitive technique that temporarily limits time in bed to consolidate sleep and rebuild sleep drive.
best_for: Those who spend too long in bed
instructions: Limit bed time to that amount
Gradually extend by 15 min as sleep improves

items.title: Stimulus Control for Sleep
items.description: Retrain your brain to associate bed only with sleep by following strict rules about bed use.
instructions: Use bed only for sleep and intimacy
Go to bed only when sleepy
Wake at same time regardless of sleep

items.title: Energy Investment Analysis
items.description: Evaluate activities by their energy return on investment - some activities cost energy but others actually generate it.

items.title: Qi Gong for Energy Flow
items.description: Gentle flowing movements combined with breath and visualization to promote energy flow and calm the nervous system.
instructions: Begin with arm raises synced to breath

items.title: Posture Reset Routine
items.description: A quick sequence to counteract forward head posture and rounded shoulders from device use.
instructions: Tuck chin to create double chin

items.title: Epsom Salt Soak Protocol
items.description: A therapeutic bath protocol using Epsom salts for muscle relaxation, magnesium absorption, and stress relief.
instructions: Fill tub with warm (not hot) water

items.title: Executive Function Supports
items.description: Set up environmental supports for planning, organization, and task initiation to reduce cognitive load.

items.title: Symptom Tracking System
items.description: Develop a sustainable system for tracking symptoms, triggers, and patterns to support diagnosis and treatment.
